about.heading: Introduction of the Organization
about.content1: Mahamana Malaviya Mission is a national-level organization dedicated to spreading the ideals and thoughts of Bharat Ratna Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya Ji among society.
about.content2: The Bihar Unit was formed to fulfill Malaviya Ji's vision on the sacred land of Bihar, a region known for its ancient heritage of knowledge and culture.
about.missionText: To build a society where education is combined with strong moral values and patriotism.

mahamana.heading: Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya: The Mahamana
mahamana.intro: Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya was a towering figure in the history of modern India. A multifaceted personality, he was a great educationist, an eloquent orator, a dedicated freedom fighter, a pioneering journalist, and a social reformer. He is revered as a 'Karmayogi'.
mahamana.quote: If we want to make our nation great, we must build youth with strong character and patriotism.

life.title: 1. Life Sketch (Jeevan Vritt)
life.early: Born on December 25, 1861, in Prayagraj into a Brahmin family known for Sanskrit scholarship. He graduated from the University of Calcutta in 1884.
life.career: Began as a teacher (Rs. 40/month), became editor of 'Hindustan' (1887), and a highly successful lawyer. At age 50, he gave up law to serve the nation.
life.politics: Served as President of the Indian National Congress four times (1909, 1918, 1932, 1933). Awarded Bharat Ratna in 2014.

vision.title: 2. Vision and Philosophy
vision.synthesis: Synthesis of Tradition and Modernity: Believed in blending Western scientific advancement with Eastern spiritual wisdom.
vision.education: Holistic Education: Emphasized 'patriotism with piety'. Education was about character building, not just degrees.
vision.harmony: Social Reform: Worked to eradicate untouchability and advocated for Hindu-Muslim unity.

bhu.title: 3. Founding of BHU (The Magnum Opus)
bhu.dream: Envisioned a national university completely Indian in spirit to produce character-driven youth.
bhu.beggar: Known as the 'Prince of Beggars', he raised huge funds from kings and commoners alike.
bhu.realization: Established in 1916 on Vasant Panchami. It was the first residential university in modern India.

nation.title: 4. Contribution to Nation Building
nation.freedom: Active in Salt Satyagraha and Civil Disobedience. Attended the Second Round Table Conference.
nation.journalism: Founded 'The Leader', 'Abhyudaya', and served as Chairman of Hindustan Times.
nation.hindi: Championed Hindi language recognition in courts and administration.
nation.motto: Popularized the national motto 'Satyameva Jayate' (Truth Alone Triumphs).
